ui.title: OMNI-DATABASE
ui.status_sub: Select a module from the menu.

pa.name: T-45d POWER ARMOR
pa.lore: First combat model used in Anchorage. Steel plating, low mobility.

pa.name: T-51b POWER ARMOR
pa.lore: Pinnacle of engineering. Polylaminate composite. Fallout 1 icon.

pa.name: X-01 / APA
pa.lore: Developed by the Enclave post-war. Far superior to pre-war models.

pa.name: ASSAULT RIFLE
pa.lore: An assault rifle is a selective fire rifle that uses an intermediate cartridge and a detachable magazine. Assault rifles are the standard infantry weapons in most modern armies.

pa.name: ELECTROMAGNETIC PULSE
pa.lore: An electromagnetic pulse (EMP) is a short burst of electromagnetic energy capable of disabling or damaging electrical and electronic equipment. This property led to its weaponization by the military, from man-portable weapons to the mighty nuclear weapons.

pa.name: MACHINE GUN
pa.lore: A machine gun is a fully automatic mounted or portable firearm, usually designed to provide sustained automatic fire, appearing in several Fallout titles.

pa.name: POWER ARMOR
pa.lore: Power armor, also referred to as powered armor, powered combat infantry armor, and powered infantry armor, is a type of personal infantry suit intended for combat and heavy-labor roles, similar to that of an infantry fighting vehicle. Power armor development first began before the Great War in 2065 by United States defense contractors, including West Tek.

pa.name: POWER FIST
pa.lore: A power fist is a type of glove or armored gauntlet, with a powered ram or similar device which improves the impact of the wielder's Unarmed strikes.

pa.name: PULSE PISTOL
pa.lore: Pulse pistols, sometimes called Pulse guns, are energy weapons designed to fire electrical pulses at their targets, and depending on the model can damage or disable electronics such as robots or power armor.

pa.name: SONIC EMITTER (WEAPON)
pa.lore: The sonic-soundwave-emitter-projecto-gun, or more simply the sonic emitter, is a weapon in the Fallout: New Vegas add-on Old World Blues.

pa.name: T60 PISTOL
pa.lore: The T60 pistol is a handgun in the Fallout TV series and Fallout Shelter.

pa.name: MEDICAL MALPRACTICE
pa.lore: Medical Malpractice is a non-automatic pistol in Fallout 76, first introduced with the Wild Appalachia update. It was made available for crafting by a plan from Daily Ops with the Locked & Loaded update. == Background == Medical Malpractice is a .44 pistol variant manufactured by Red Raptor Firearms, a company based out of Austin, Texas.

pa.name: ARMOR PIERCING 10MM PISTOL
pa.lore: The armor piercing 10mm pistol is a weapon that appears in Fallout Shelter. == Background == The large-framed N99 was selected as the standard issue conventional sidearm of the United States military, following the phaseout of the N80 in 2051. The long-barreled pistol remained in service for 26 years, until the Great War destroyed the United States.

energy.name: AER9 LASER RIFLE
energy.lore: Standard army rifle. Durable and blocky.

energy.name: PLASMA CASTER
energy.lore: Industrial Winchester P94 plasma weapon. Fires a plasma torus.

energy.name: 10MM PISTOL
energy.lore: 10mm pistols are pistols that appear in Fallout, Fallout 2, Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Fallout 4, Fallout 76, Fallout Shelter, Fallout: New California and Van Buren, as well as the Fallout TV series.

energy.name: ALIEN BLASTER
energy.lore: The alien blaster is a powerful, compact energy weapon of alien origin which appears in Fallout, Fallout 2, Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Fallout 4, Fallout 76, Fallout Shelter, and Fallout: The Board Game.

energy.name: FLAMER
energy.lore: A flamer or flamethrower is a large weapon that projects an ignited stream of flammable liquid, and requires a source of fuel to operate. In Fallout 3, flamers use the Big Guns skill, whereas in Fallout: New Vegas, they are moved to the Energy Weapons skill.

energy.name: GATLING LASER
energy.lore: The Gatling laser is an energy weapon that appears in Fallout, Fallout 2, Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Fallout 4, Fallout 76 and Fallout Tactics.

energy.name: GAUSS RIFLE
energy.lore: Gauss rifles are a class of magnetic projectile weapons that have appeared multiple times in the Fallout series.

energy.name: GRENADE LAUNCHER
energy.lore: A grenade launcher is a weapon that propels a grenade with more accuracy, higher velocity and to greater distances than a soldier could throw it by hand. The term encompasses a broad array of weapons, from small, handheld launchers to crew-served automatic weapons, all being man-portable weapons firing grenade rounds.

energy.name: HAND GRENADE
energy.lore: A hand grenade is a thrown weapon that appears in all of the Fallout games. Most contain explosives designed to inflict damage in a wide blast radius by the fragmentation of their outer cases.

energy.name: LASER MUSKET
energy.lore: The laser musket is a weapon in Fallout 4, Fallout 76, Fallout Shelter, and the Fallout TV series.

energy.name: LASER PISTOL
energy.lore: Laser pistols are high-tech sidearms that emit a concentrated beam of coherent light, with sufficient wattage to do considerable damage. They can be powered by various power sources, but most models use an internal capacitor, charged by a small energy cell.

energy.name: LASER RIFLE
energy.lore: Laser rifles are high-tech weapons that emit a concentrated beam of coherent light, with sufficient wattage to do considerable damage. They can be powered by battery packs, fusion cells, or cabled power systems, but most models use an internal capacitor, charged with microfusion cells.

energy.name: PLASMA GRENADE
energy.lore: A plasma grenade is a thrown weapon that appears in all of the Fallout games. Plasma grenades release a burst of ionized plasma gas when detonated, rather than the typical explosion propelling fragments of normal hand grenades.

energy.name: PLASMA PISTOL
energy.lore: Plasma pistols are high-tech weapons firing superheated bolts of plasma, powered by small energy cells, energy cells or plasma cartridges.

energy.name: PLASMA RIFLE
energy.lore: Plasma rifles or plasma casters are energy based weapons that appear in Fallout, Fallout 2, Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Fallout 4, Fallout 76, Fallout Tactics, Fallout: Brotherhood of Steel, Fallout Shelter and Fallout: The Board Game.

energy.name: PULSE RIFLE
energy.lore: The pulse rifle is an energy weapon in Fallout 2 and Fallout Tactics.

energy.name: TESLA CANNON
energy.lore: The Tesla cannon is a series of shoulder-mounted directed energy weapons that have appeared multiple times in the Fallout series.

energy.name: TURBO PLASMA RIFLE
energy.lore: Turbo plasma rifles are energy based weapons that appear in Fallout, Fallout 2, and Fallout: Brotherhood of Steel.

robots.name: MR. HANDY
robots.lore: Domestic robot. Gutsy version served in the military.

robots.name: SECURITRON
robots.lore: The PDQ-88b Securitron (RobCo security model 2060-B) is a private security robot. They are charged with protecting the Strip and can be found there alongside the Lucky 38 and Big MT in Fallout: New Vegas and its add-on Old World Blues, respectively. They also appear in the Fallout TV series and Fallout Shelter, and variants of the Securitron appear as Atomic Shop items in Fallout 76, known as the A&D Vendo-Tron.

robots.name: LIBERTY PRIME
robots.lore: Liberty Prime, later renamed to Liberty Prime Mark II, is a giant combat robot originally constructed by the Strategic Arms Division of the United States Army as a superweapon to achieve victory against China in the Sino-American War. It was intended to be deployed in combat as the spearhead of the liberation of Anchorage, Alaska from PLA occupation, but never saw deployment due to its lack of a suitable power source. Left dormant within the Pentagon in Washington, D.C.

robots.name: ROBOBRAIN
robots.lore: A military and research robot platform integrating human brain tissue for advanced tactical behavior.

robots.name: EYEBOT
robots.lore: A floating utility and reconnaissance robot used for broadcasting, scouting, and field support.

robots.name: ROBOBRAIN
robots.lore: The Robobrain is a next-generation brain bot-type cyborg appearing throughout the Fallout series. Developed by General Atomics International and the US Army with indirect support from RobCo Industries, the Robobrain was designed from the ground up as a multirole platform for use by military and civilian clients.

robots.name: THE ART OF FALLOUT 4
robots.lore: The Art of Fallout 4 is an art book accompanying Fallout 4. == Contents == The Art of Fallout 4 has 368 pages and features never before seen designs and concept art from the game's environments, characters, weapons, and more, along with commentary from the developers themselves. It was made available on December 22, 2015.

devices.name: PIP-BOY 3000
devices.lore: Personal computer. Model 3000 has a biometric lock.

devices.name: G.E.C.K.
devices.lore: Garden of Eden Creation Kit. Suitcase with a matter replicator.

devices.name: DOM PEDRO (WEAPON)
devices.lore: Dom Pedro is a unique weapon owned by the Ghoul.

devices.name: FAT MAN
devices.lore: The M42 "Fat Man" Launcher, also referred to as the Fat Man Tactical Nuclear Catapult, is a man-portable, shoulder-fired catapult weapon system that launches tactical nuclear ordnance, the mini nuke. It appears in Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Fallout 4, Fallout 76, Fallout Shelter and Fallout: The Board Game.

devices.name: KATANA
devices.lore: The katana (ÂàÄ or „Åã„Åü„Å™) is a type of melee weapon which has appeared multiple times in the Fallout series.

devices.name: LAND MINE
devices.lore: Land mines are explosive devices used as weapons in Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Fallout 4, and Fallout 76. When armed, the mine is placed on the ground, where it will lie dormant until an enemy strays too close, upon which its proximity fuse will trip, detonating the mine shortly thereafter.

devices.name: NUCLEAR WEAPONS
devices.lore: A nuclear weapon is an explosive device that derives its destructive force from nuclear reactions, either fission or a combination of fission and fusion. They are often colloquially referred to as a nuke or nukes, and are the primary source of nuclear fallout.

devices.name: RAILGUN
devices.lore: Railguns, also known as rail guns or rail cannons, are weapons seen throughout the Fallout series.

devices.name: RAILWAY RIFLE
devices.lore: The railway rifle is a improvised weapon that pneumatically fires railway spikes at high velocities, typically with enough force to sever and pin limbs to nearby walls or objects.

devices.name: SWORD
devices.lore: Various swords serve as melee weapons in Fallout 2, Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Fallout 4, Fallout 76 and Fallout Shelter. The label of "sword" encompasses a wide variety of blades used for slashing and thrusting attacks.

devices.name: UNIQUE WEAPONS
devices.lore: Unique weapons are one-of-a-kind weapons that are found only once in a specific game. Unique weapons generally have better stats than their common counterparts and may have a unique effect.

devices.name: WEAPON
devices.lore: Weapons are items used to attack a target and deliver damage.

devices.name: CITADEL TERMINAL ENTRIES
devices.lore: The Citadel terminal entries are a series of entries found on terminals in the Citadel in Fallout 3.

categories.name: PRE-WAR ERA (2050-2077)
categories.desc: Resource Wars, New Plague, Canada Annexation.

categories.name: THE GREAT WAR (2077)
categories.desc: October 23rd. Doomsday and Birth of the Wasteland.

categories.name: DARK AGES (2078-2160)
categories.desc: Exodus, Mariposa, Master's Birth and the Hub.

categories.name: HEROIC AGE (2161-2241)
categories.desc: Fallout 1 & 2. Destruction of Unity and Enclave.

categories.name: MODERN ERA (2250+)
categories.desc: NCR-BOS War, Van Buren, New Vegas, Washington.

prewar.name: 2052: RESOURCE WARS
prewar.lore: The beginning of the end. Europe invades the Middle East for the last drops of oil. The UN collapses in July. The United States closes its borders. Televisions show dried Texas oil wells.

prewar.name: 2077: FUEL CRISIS
prewar.lore: Just before the war, gasoline prices skyrocket.

prewar.name: 2054: PROJECT SAFEHOUSE INITIATED
prewar.lore: The U.S. government initiated Project Safehouse during escalating global instability. Vault-Tec received contracts to design and build the vault shelter network.

prewar.name: 2066: CHINA INVADES ALASKA
prewar.lore: China invaded Alaska to secure strategic fuel resources, triggering the most intense phase of the Sino-American War and a prolonged U.S. military response.

prewar.name: BATTLE RIFLE
prewar.lore: A battle rifle is a military service rifle that fires a full power rifle cartridge, such as 7.62x51mm NATO. This designation is usually given to post-World War II select-fire infantry rifles, such as the FN FAL or the M14.

prewar.name: SINO-AMERICAN WAR
prewar.lore: The Sino-American War was a pivotal event in the timeline of the Fallout series: a global war between the People's Republic of China and the United States of America as the two leading superpowers in the late 20th century and throughout most of the 21st century following World War II and the Divergence. As resources began to dwindle, both nations clashed over control of the last remaining energy resources on Earth, drawing in client states and annexed territories as both civilian and military resources were harnessed to achieve victory over the other side, all in a struggle that was as much about resources as it was about ideology. The war was marked by atrocities on both sides against foreign and domestic populations, steady escalation of hostilities up to and including the use of nuclear, biological, and chemical weapons, and gradual transition of both states into totalitarian dictatorships no different from each other.

prewar.name: TIMELINE
prewar.lore: What follows is a complete timeline of all known canonical events in the Fallout universe. For clarity and performance, some parts of the timeline were separated into other articles: Events unique to Fallout Tactics are found in Fallout Tactics timeline.

prewar.name: TIMELINE OF MAJOR EVENTS
prewar.lore: What follows is an edited version of the Fallout timeline focusing on major events and omitting minor, inconsequential occurrences, such as fixing pipes or delivery dates, and most personal occurrences, focusing on those tied to the rise and development of factions, settlements, and technologies. Historical events with no impact on the Fallout setting are not included.

prewar.name: FALLOUT 3
prewar.lore: Fallout 3 is a post-apocalyptic role-playing video game developed by Bethesda Game Studios and published by Bethesda Softworks. It is the third major installment in the Fallout series (fifth overall) and a sequel to Interplay Entertainment's Fallout and Fallout 2. It was released on October 28, 2008, in North America, on October 31, 2008, in Europe and Australia and on December 4, 2008, in Japan.

greatwar.name: OCTOBER 23, 2077
greatwar.lore: Nuclear exchange. Most major cities vanish. West Tek takes a direct hit.

greatwar.name: OCTOBER 23, 2077: NUCLEAR EXCHANGE
greatwar.lore: Escalating alerts became confirmed launches and full nuclear exchange. The Great War lasted roughly two hours and destroyed most organized civilization.

greatwar.name: GREAT WAR
greatwar.lore: The Great War, also simply referred to as The War, was a pivotal event in the setting of the Fallout series: a global thermonuclear exchange that took place on Saturday, October 23, 2077, as a result of the then-ongoing Sino-American War between China and the United States of America. It resulted in the destruction of all participating nations and abroad, global disruption of the climate and billions of casualties as a result of nuclear blasts, exposure to radiation and the subsequent collapse of social and government structures, all within the span of just two hours. The landscape of the United States and the rest of the world were transformed into a wasteland and even 200 years later, the consequences of the Great War can still be felt in the form of lingering radiation, rampant sickness and disease, hostile mutated creatures, environmental degradation, and significant scarcity of resources resulting in mass societal breakdown and regression to violent lawlessness.

darkages.name: 2077: VAULT DWELLERS ENTER
darkages.lore: Selected citizens enter Vaults. Most experiments begin immediately. Control vaults function as designed.

darkages.name: 2084: SHADY SANDS FOUNDED
darkages.lore: Survivors from Vault 15 establish a small farming village. It will become the capital of NCR.

darkages.name: 2091: VAULT CITY FOUNDED
darkages.lore: Vault 8 opens on schedule. Using their G.E.C.K., residents build a sterile, high-tech settlement.

darkages.name: 2102: VAULT 76 OPENS
darkages.lore: Control Vault opens after 25 years. Dwellers emerge to reclaim Appalachia (Fallout 76).

darkages.name: 2134: MASTER'S EXPERIMENTS BEGIN
darkages.lore: Richard Grey, now The Master, begins creating Super Mutants from wastelanders using FEV.

darkages.name: 2141: GREAT KHANS FOUNDED
darkages.lore: Descended from Vault 15. Become one of the most notorious raider groups in the wasteland.

darkages.name: 2152: MAXSON'S DEATH
darkages.lore: Roger Maxson, founder of the Brotherhood of Steel, dies. His son takes command.

darkages.name: 2155: THE HUB FLOURISHES
darkages.lore: The Hub becomes the trading center of New California. Water Merchants control the economy.

heroic.name: 2161: FALLOUT 1
heroic.lore: The Vault Dweller leaves Vault 13 in 2161 to find a Water Chip for their home. In 2162 they destroy the Master and his Cathedral, but upon returning they are exiled from their vault.

heroic.name: 2241: FALLOUT 2
heroic.lore: A severe drought hits Arroyo, forcing the Chosen One to leave in search of a Garden of Eden Creation Kit. The Chosen One later destroys the Enclave's oil rig, saving their people.

heroic.name: 2189: NCR OFFICIALLY FOUNDED
heroic.lore: After a transitional period of local governance, the New California Republic was formally established as a republic centered on Shady Sands.

heroic.name: THE HUB
heroic.lore: "A Trader's Life" The Hub, also called The Hub Trading Co., is a major trading center and settlement established in an old town relatively untouched by the Great War. Since its foundation, the Hub became an economic powerhouse, as a crossroads for commerce and staging base for caravan houses, a major producer of agricultural goods thanks to the farms surrounding the city, and supplier of vital water for much of New California. The caravan houses that work the routes trade in everything: chems, tires, guns, bullets, food, brahmin, dirt, even scraps of metal.

modern.name: 2276: OPERATION SUNBURST
modern.lore: NCR forces seize the HELIOS One solar plant from the Brotherhood. Mojave chapter loses half its Paladins; war ends in NCR‚Äôs favor.

modern.name: 2277: BATTLE OF PROJECT PURITY
modern.lore: Enclave occupies Project Purity but is repelled by Lyons‚Äô Brotherhood. Water purifier is activated, securing clean water for the Capital Wasteland.

modern.name: 2281: SECOND BATTLE OF HOOVER DAM
modern.lore: Final clash for New Vegas‚Äôs future. Caesar‚Äôs Legion‚Äôs assault is halted at Hoover Dam. The New California Republic celebrates victory, cementing its control over the Mojave.

modern.name: 2283: SHADY SANDS DESTROYED
modern.lore: Shady Sands, the first NCR capital, was destroyed by nuclear detonation. The loss accelerated fragmentation and instability across NCR territory.

modern.name: 2296: FALLOUT TV SEASON 1 EVENTS
modern.lore: In 2296, events around Vault 33 drive Lucy into the wasteland, linking vault politics, NCR remnants, and pre-war corporate legacies.

modern.name: MYSTERIOUS STRANGER (CHARACTER)
modern.lore: The Mysterious Stranger is an enigmatic character that has made multiple appearances in the Fallout series, typically only when one has the Mysterious Stranger perk and uses V.A.T.S.. == Background == The Mysterious Stranger has been spotted throughout the wasteland in the aftermath of the Great War, always wearing his trademark trench coat and fedora. He appears suddenly to certain people during combat and assists them with his signature .44 Magnum before vanishing as abruptly as he appeared.

control.name: VAULT 8
control.lore: Perfect Vault. Opened after 10 years. Residents built Vault City with G.E.C.K.

control.name: VAULT 13
control.lore: Home of the Vault Dweller (Fallout 1). Intended to stay closed for 200 years. Water chip failure.

control.name: VAULT 76
control.lore: Control vault. Opened after 25 years. Dwellers emerged to reclaim Appalachia. Featured in Fallout 76.

control.name: CONTROL VAULT
control.lore: Non-experimental Vaults, or control Vaults, were Vaults designed and built by Vault-Tec to provide baseline data in order to compare and evaluate the results of experiments conducted in non-control Vaults. These Vaults functioned exactly as advertised by the corporation, with no underlying scheme intended to take place within the Vault itself.

control.name: MULTI-GENERATIONAL STARSHIP
control.lore: The multi-generational starship was a long-term plan by the Enclave to address the problem of Earth's destruction in the wake of a global thermonuclear war. Fearing that the war would render the surface of the world uninhabitable, the Enclave elected to create an interstellar vessel to take the "best and brightest" off world to a new planet that could be colonized and human civilization started anew.

control.name: VAULT 8
control.lore: Vault 8 is a Vault located in the post-War settlement of Vault City in Fallout 2. == Background == Vault 8 was a control Vault that was intended to open and re-colonize the surface 10 years after being sealed. The Vault was designed to house a hundred or so people.

social.name: VAULT 11
social.lore: They were told to sacrifice one person each year. Eventually only 5 residents remained.

social.name: VAULT 77
social.lore: One man and a crate of puppets. Psychological isolation experiment. The man went insane.

social.name: VAULT 101
social.lore: Isolated from outside. Overseer had absolute power. Home of Lone Wanderer (Fallout 3).

social.name: VAULT 19
social.lore: Divided into Red and Blue sectors. Subliminal messages created paranoia. Residents turned on each other.

social.name: VAULT 27
social.lore: Designed for 500 but crammed with 2000 people. No privacy. Extreme stress and conflict.

social.name: VAULT 68
social.lore: Social experiment. 999 men and only 1 woman. Results unknown but presumed catastrophic.

social.name: VAULT 69
social.lore: Inverse of Vault 68. 999 women and only 1 man. Social dynamics experiment.

social.name: VAULT 15
social.lore: Vault 15 housed ideologically diverse groups; its descendants helped establish major post-war settlements including Shady Sands.

social.name: VAULT 106
social.lore: Vault 106 used psychoactive chemicals on residents, causing severe psychological collapse.

social.name: VAULT 21
social.lore: Vault 21 used gambling as a dispute-resolution system and later became tied to New Vegas politics.

social.name: DEMONSTRATION VAULT
social.lore: A demonstration Vault is a showing to the general public illustrating the benefits of a Vault-Tec Vault.

social.name: LIST OF KNOWN VAULTS
social.lore: The following page lists all Vault-Tec Corporation Vault series shelters and facilities inspired by them.

social.name: MAKESHIFT VAULT
social.lore: The makeshift vault is a location in the Toxic Valley region of Appalachia. == Background == A nuclear fallout shelter constructed by former Vault-Tec Corporation contractors using supplies and materials stolen from Vault construction sites in Appalachia. The builders decided on this course of action after they were informed that they'd not receive a spot in the Vaults they helped build due to being "unessential." By October 2077, the work was mostly completed, with construction on this "budget" Vault well ahead of schedule.

social.name: THREE VAULTS
social.lore: The Three Vaults are a unique network of three interconnected Vaults built in Los Angeles, California.

social.name: VAULT
social.lore: The Vaults‚Ñ¢ are a series of subterranean shelters designed and constructed by the Vault-Tec Corporation under a joint operation contract with the United States government (codenamed Project Safehouse) to create hard-sealed fallout shelters outwardly intended to protect a selected portion of the American population from impending nuclear holocaust in the 21st century, so that the survivors could eventually repopulate post-apocalypse America on Reclamation Day. Unknown to the public at large, outside a minority of control Vaults, the main purpose of the Vaults was to conduct social experiments on the inhabitants, often involving mental, psychological, and physical torture for the purpose of scientific research into various, often unethical fields of study.

social.name: VAULT 12
social.lore: Vault 12 is one of the Vaults constructed by the Vault-Tec Corporation. It is located in Bakersfield, California, in the post-War ghoul settlement of Necropolis. == Background == Constructed under the sprawling metropolis of Bakersfield, Vault 12 was billed as "built with every amenity in mind for the prospective Vault Dweller," and that it had "been fitted with the newest in Vault Water Purification Systems.

social.name: VAULT 27
social.lore: Vault 27 is one of the Vault-Tec Vaults. == Background == As part of the Vault experiment, this Vault would be deliberately overcrowded. 2000 people would be assigned to enter, double the total sustainable amount.

social.name: VAULT 29
social.lore: Vault 29 is one of the Vaults built by Vault-Tec. Located on the West Coast, the Vault housed children, mostly teenagers, from affluent families. == Background == Trisha Miller, a Vault-Tec University student, was concerned that her assignment would be a janitor in Vault 29 on the West Coast, with "a bunch of obnoxious rich teenagers." == Notes == In the Fallout Bible, the Vault is said to have contained only children under the age of 15, with adults purposefully diverted elsewhere.

social.name: VAULT 29 (VAN BUREN)
social.lore: Vault 29 is one of the Vaults built by Vault-Tec. == Background == As part of the Vault experiment, it was meant to be populated by young children, with the original inhabitants being no more than 15 years old. Harold emerged from Vault 29 in 2090.

social.name: VAULT 32
social.lore: Vault 32 is a location and Vault-Tec Vault in Los Angeles, California in the Fallout TV series. == Background == === Origins === One of the interconnected Three Vaults near Santa Monica, Los Angeles, Vault 32 was directly connected with Vault 31 and 33. However, direct contact between the populations was limited - officially to prevent the spread of threats, but with the ability to come to each other's aid in times of need.

social.name: VAULT 33
social.lore: Vault 33 is a Vault in what was once Santa Monica in the Fallout TV series. Its entrance is located shortly south of the Santa Monica Pier. Along with Vault 31 and Vault 32, it is one of the "Three Vaults" linked by a triangle of tunnels.

social.name: VAULT 65
social.lore: Vault 65 would have been a Vault-Tec vault in Appalachia. == Background == The vault's original purpose in the vault experiment is unknown. The vault is powered by four generators, similar in design to the generators found in Vaults 51 and 94.

social.name: VAULT 77
social.lore: Vault 77 is one of the Vault series of fallout shelters developed by Vault-Tec. It was featured in a promotional, crossover comic strip entitled One Man, and a Crate of Puppets, released to promote Fallout 3. Only one man was sealed inside with only a crate of puppets for company.

social.name: VAULT BLAST DOOR
social.lore: Unlike internal doors, Vault blast doors or Vault gear doors are designed not only to keep contaminants and radiation out but also to protect the occupants from danger. These massive doors are one of the iconic elements of a Vault, their gear design instantly recognizable in the wastelands.

social.name: VAULT DEPRESSIVE SYNDROME
social.lore: Vault depressive syndrome, or VDS, is a mental health illness that affects Vault Dwellers.

social.name: VAULT-TEC CORPORATION
social.lore: The Vault-Tec Corporation,(Note 1) also known as Vault-Tec Industries, Vault-Tec Incorporated, or simply as Vault-Tec, was a pre-War defense corporation which won the federal government contracts to design and implement a network of bunkers known as Vaults with the stated intent of preserving a small fraction of the U.S. population. By the time of the Great War, it was the largest company in America, valued at an estimated trillion dollars, with stakes in countless industries and businesses.

science.name: VAULT 111
science.lore: Cryogenic suspension experiment. Sole Survivor's home (Fallout 4). Most residents died when life support failed.

science.name: VAULT 22
science.lore: Tested fungal-based pest control. Spores mutated and infected residents. Turned them into plant hybrids.

science.name: VAULT 108
science.lore: Cloning experiment. Subject Gary was cloned hundreds of times. All clones say only 'Gary'.

science.name: VAULT PROGRAM SCOPE
science.lore: The vault network was presented as a civil defense system, but many facilities were designed for controlled long-term experimentation on residents.

science.name: VAULT 87
science.lore: Vault 87 conducted FEV-based experimentation that produced many Capital Wasteland super mutants.

science.name: LOS ANGELES VAULT
science.lore: "Flame of the Ancient World" The Los Angeles Vault is a functional demonstration site designed by Vault-Tec to present their Vaults to the public. It held survivors during the War, who would leave to become the peoples of Boneyard. Some decades after the War, it would serve as the Master's main base beneath the Cathedral.

science.name: VAULT 120
science.lore: Vault 120 is a cut Vault-Tec Vault located off the Atlantic coast of Massachusetts, underwater in the Commonwealth. It would have been involved in the cut quest 20 Leagues Under the Sea. The adventure there would involve a sentient giant squid contained inside the Vault, and the Vault itself would be inspired by BioShock.

science.name: VAULT 24
science.lore: Vault 24 is a Vault-Tec Vault located in the Mojave Wasteland. It appears as a location in the Fallout TV series, while a jumpsuit from the Vault was cut from Fallout: New Vegas. == Background == Vault 24 was designed to preserve and continue research into mind-control technologies, with Vault-Tec's experimental staff using Americans assigned to the Vault as test subjects once the protocol was initiated.

science.name: VAULT 4
science.lore: Vault 4 is a Vault-Tec Vault located beneath the Hawthorne Medical Laboratories campus in Los Angeles, California in the Fallout TV series. == Background == Before the Great War, Vault 4 was featured in advertisements and Vault orientation videos, with Cooper Howard serving as the spokesman. The Vault's experiment was publicly revealed in these advertisements: it would be governed by scientists living and working there full-time (technocracy).

science.name: VAULT JUMPSUIT
science.lore: Vault jumpsuits or Vault suits (terms used interchangeably) are the iconic gear of Vault dwellers and by and large the symbol of Vault-Tec Corporation, being worn by mascots Vault Boy and Vault Girl.

esoteric.name: VAULT 12
esoteric.lore: Door designed to never fully close. Residents exposed to radiation. All became ghouls. Became Necropolis.

esoteric.name: VAULT 92
esoteric.lore: Create super-soldiers via subliminal suggestion. White noise in speakers. Residents went violently insane.

esoteric.name: VAULT 34
esoteric.lore: Oversupplied with weapons but strict rationing. Reactor flooded. Residents became ghouls trapped inside.

west.name: THE GLOW
west.lore: West Tek research facility ruins. Direct nuclear hit. Highly irradiated. FEV research site.

west.name: THE HUB
west.lore: Major trading center. Water Merchants Guild controls economy. Crossroads of the wasteland.

west.name: SHADY SANDS / NCR CAPITAL
west.lore: Founded by Vault 15 dwellers. Grew into NCR capital. Symbol of post-war civilization and democracy.

west.name: NEW RENO
west.lore: Sin city of the wasteland. Controlled by mob families. Casinos, drugs, and prostitution.

west.name: SAN FRANCISCO
west.lore: Controlled by the Shi. Descendants of Chinese submarine crew. Advanced technology and Hubologists.

west.name: THE CATHEDRAL
west.lore: Master's base in Los Angeles. Front for FEV experiments. Destroyed by Vault Dweller with nuclear bomb.

west.name: THE BONEYARD
west.lore: Ruins of Los Angeles. Home to Gun Runners and Followers of the Apocalypse. Scavenger territory.

west.name: FALLOUT
west.lore: Fallout: A Post Nuclear Role Playing Game is a computer role-playing game developed by Interplay Entertainment and its division Dragonplay (later Black Isle Studios). It was published on October 10, 1997. The game received a direct sequel, Fallout 2.

west.name: 10MM PISTOL (FALLOUT 3)
west.lore: The 10mm pistol, officially the N99 10mm pistol, is a small gun in Fallout 3. == Background == The large-framed N99 was selected as the standard issue conventional sidearm of the United States military, following the phaseout of the N80 in 2051. The long-barreled pistol remained in service for 26 years, until the Great War destroyed the United States.

mojave.name: NEW VEGAS STRIP
mojave.lore: Preserved by Mr. House. Three families run casinos. Pinnacle of luxury in the wasteland.

mojave.name: HOOVER DAM
mojave.lore: Provides electricity to Vegas and NCR. Fought over by NCR and Legion. Site of two battles.

mojave.name: CAMP MCCARRAN
mojave.lore: Pre-war airport. NCR military headquarters in Mojave. Major staging area near Vegas.

mojave.name: NELLIS AIR FORCE BASE
mojave.lore: Home of the Boomers. Isolated tribals obsessed with explosives. Protected by artillery bombardment.

mojave.name: BIG MT (BIG EMPTY)
mojave.lore: Pre-war research dome. Run by brain-in-jar scientists. Created cazadores and nightstalkers.

mojave.name: ZION CANYON
mojave.lore: Untouched by war. Home to tribal communities. Joshua Graham's refuge. Featured in Honest Hearts.

mojave.name: JACOBSTOWN
mojave.lore: Peaceful super mutant settlement. Led by Marcus from Fallout 2. Refuge for outcasts.

mojave.name: HIDDEN VALLEY BUNKER
mojave.lore: "Brothers of Steel" "Mutant Massacre" The Hidden Valley bunker is an unmarked location within Hidden Valley in the Mojave Wasteland in Fallout: New Vegas. It is the current headquarters of the Mojave Brotherhood of Steel following their defeat by the New California Republic at HELIOS One during Operation: Sunburst in 2276. == Background == Originally built by the U.S.

mojave.name: LOCATION
mojave.lore: == Maps == World map Fallout 3 world map Fallout: New Vegas world map Fallout 4 world map Fallout 76 world map == Series == ==== Television ==== Fallout TV series locations ==== Main games ==== ==== Spin-offs ==== == Countries == Pre-War countries == States == State == Regions == == Categories == Locations by game Cut locations Mentioned-only Test cell Unmarked Locations by faction Locations by type

mojave.name: ALL ROADS
mojave.lore: All Roads is a Fallout graphic novel written by Chris Avellone. The cover artists are Geof Darrow and Peter Doherty (colors), while the interior artists are Jean Diaz and Wellinton Alves. The art style changes when focus is shifted to another character.

east.name: CAPITAL WASTELAND (D.C.)
east.lore: Washington D.C. ruins. Brotherhood stronghold. Super mutants everywhere. Site of Project Purity.

east.name: DIAMOND CITY
east.lore: Built in Fenway Park stadium. Largest settlement in Commonwealth. Anti-synth paranoia.

east.name: THE INSTITUTE
east.lore: Underground city beneath CIT ruins. Most advanced technology in wasteland. Create synths.

east.name: RIVET CITY
east.lore: Settlement in beached aircraft carrier. One of largest communities in Capital Wasteland. Science community.

east.name: FAR HARBOR
east.lore: Island off Maine coast. Covered in radioactive fog. Conflict between locals, Children of Atom, and synths.

east.name: THE PITT
east.lore: Industrial hellscape. Slaves work steel mills. Raiders rule. Featured in Fallout 3 DLC.

east.name: MEGATON
east.lore: A major Capital Wasteland settlement built around an unexploded atomic bomb.

east.name: FAR HARBOR (LOCATION)
east.lore: Far Harbor is a location on Mount Desert Island in the Fallout 4 add-on Far Harbor. Once known as Bar Harbor, a seaside resort town off the coast of Maine, after the Great War, it became one of the few bastions of civilization on the island due to the unpredictable spread of the radioactive phenomenon known as the Fog. Coming to be called Far Harbor, the native harbormen live day after day trying to survive against the Fog's encroachment, threats from the mutated wildlife sharing the island, and by 2287, tensions mounting towards open war against a sect of the Church of the Children of Atom who desire to blanket the entire island in "Atom's veil" and either kill or drive off the locals.

east.name: GIANT ANT
east.lore: Giant ants are hostile creatures commonly found in the wasteland, including the former state of California, the Capital Wasteland, the Mojave Wasteland, the Commonwealth and Appalachia.

east.name: MEGATON
east.lore: Megaton is a fortified settlement in the Capital Wasteland in 2277. This shantytown is built around a crater with an undetonated megaton class atomic bomb at its center, after which the town is named. The town of Megaton is protected by large metal walls made from various scavenged materials, primarily the scraps of old pre-War airplanes, which were assembled and reforged together several decades ago by the founders of Megaton in an effort to make the town safer.

east.name: RADSTAG
east.lore: Radstags (although "stag" was once only used to refer to a male deer) are a species of mutated deer. These creatures live in Appalachia, the Commonwealth and the Island.

east.name: STATE
east.lore: A state of the United States was a pre-War geographic territory with established borders within the United States of America, formed into commonwealths, and then into the federal republic. Though essentially defunct with the dissolution of the United States following the nuclear apocalypse, the names of the former American states are still used by the inhabitants of the wasteland and mentioned multiple times in the Fallout series. == Background == Prior to the Great War, the United States of America was comprised of a total of 50 states.

east.name: APPALACHIA
east.lore: Appalachia is the name given to a geographic expanse which covers the pre-War state of West Virginia and parts of other states, including Virginia and Ohio.(Note) This area, which has several different regional names, serves as the game world of Fallout 76. Spared from most of the destruction and carnage of the Great War due to its relative isolation and lack of strategic targets, much of the surviving human population in the West Virginian core of Appalachia nonetheless perished over the following years due to the Scorched Plague. In 2102, Vault Dwellers emerged into Appalachia after 25 years of isolation inside Vault 76 and began to reclaim the wilderness.

east.name: FALLOUT 4
east.lore: Fallout 4 is a post-apocalyptic role-playing game developed by Bethesda Game Studios and published by Bethesda Softworks. It is the fifth major installment in the Fallout series (eighth overall). It was released on Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One on November 10, 2015, except in Japan, where it was released on December 17, 2015.

east.name: NUKA-WORLD (LOCATION)
east.lore: Nuka-World is a pre-War amusement park turned raider settlement in 2287. It is in Massachusetts, west of Boston. == Background == === Founding === After Nuka-Cola's success on the national market in 2044, the Nuka-Cola Corporation opened its own soda-themed amusement park, Nuka-World, for the first time on May 1, 2050.

major.name: BROTHERHOOD OF STEEL
major.lore: Tech-hoarding military order founded by Roger Maxson. Protect technology from misuse. Based in Lost Hills bunker.

major.name: NEW CALIFORNIA REPUBLIC
major.lore: Democratic federation. Largest post-war nation. Expansionist policies. Based on old-world democracy.

major.name: CAESAR'S LEGION
major.lore: Autocratic empire based on Roman culture. Founded by Edward Sallow. Brutal slavers. Controls Arizona.

major.name: ENCLAVE
major.lore: The Enclave is a secretive faction appearing as a major antagonist throughout the Fallout series, first as the main villain in Fallout 2 and again in Fallout 3. It was largely absent in Fallout 4 (although later added as Creation Club content which is enabled by default in the first next-gen update) but returned in Fallout 76 as a joinable faction. It appeared in a minor role in the Fallout TV series' first season, when Siggi Wilzig defects from the organization and sets the show's plot in motion, and takes on an expanded, overarching role in the latter half of the show's second season.

major.name: NCR FOUNDATION PROFILE
major.lore: The NCR grew from post-war settlements linked to Vault 15 descendants. It developed into a large federal republic with expansionist military and political institutions.

major.name: BROTHERHOOD OF STEEL
major.lore: The Brotherhood of Steel (commonly abbreviated to BoS) is a post-War technology-focused paramilitary order with chapters operating across the territory of the former United States of America. It was founded by rogue U.S. Army officer Captain Roger Maxson shortly after the Great War.

major.name: CAESAR'S LEGION
major.lore: Caesar's Legion (Latin: Legio Caesaris), also referred to simply as the Legion, is an imperialistic slaver society and totalitarian dictatorship founded in 2247 by Edward Sallow (Caesar) and Joshua Graham, built on the conquest and enslavement of tribal societies and lording over subjects of civilized settlements in the American southwest. To enforce unity, the Legion loosely models itself after the military of the Roman Empire, repurposing its language and aesthetics for the post-apocalypse. As of 2281, the Legion controls large amounts of territory east of the Colorado River, primarily in the former states of Arizona and New Mexico, with footholds in Utah and Colorado.

major.name: MINIGUN
major.lore: A minigun is a multi-barrel rotary machine gun with a high rate of fire, employing Gatling-style rotating barrels. It was a standard military weapon before the Great War, with Rockwell's CZ series being the most popular choice in the United States of America.

major.name: NEW CALIFORNIA REPUBLIC
major.lore: The New California Republic (NCR) is a post-War federal republic founded in the namesake territory of New California in 2189. At its peak, its territory comprised five contiguous states located in southern California, with additional holdings in northern California, Oregon, Nevada, Arizona, and northern Mexico. Officially, the New California Republic stands for democracy, personal liberty, and rule of law; these values have been upheld unevenly both within and without.

major.name: NEW VEGAS
major.lore: New Vegas is a post-War city established in the ruins of the pre-War city of Las Vegas, Nevada in the Mojave Wasteland, with the most prominent fixture being the New Vegas Strip controlled by the enigmatic Mr. House and his Three Families who govern the Strip's casinos. It appears as a major location in the eponymous Fallout: New Vegas as well as in the Fallout TV series.

regional.name: THE INSTITUTE
regional.lore: Underground scientists. Create synthetic humans. Descended from MIT. Hidden beneath Boston ruins.

regional.name: MINUTEMEN
regional.lore: Volunteer defense force. Protect settlements. Based on colonial minutemen. Nearly destroyed before Sole Survivor.

regional.name: THE RAILROAD
regional.lore: Secret organization. Free synths from Institute. Use dead drops and safehouses. Named after Underground Railroad.

regional.name: DESERT RANGERS
regional.lore: Lawmen of the wasteland. Merged with NCR in 2271. Became NCR Rangers. Iconic dusters and masks.

regional.name: FOLLOWERS OF THE APOCALYPSE
regional.lore: A humanitarian knowledge-focused organization dedicated to medicine, education, and social recovery.

regional.name: FOLLOWERS OF THE APOCALYPSE
regional.lore: The Followers of the Apocalypse, or simply called the Followers, are a humanitarian organization originating in New California that appear multiple times in the Fallout series. The Followers' core goal is the providing of education and medical services to those in need, as well as furthering research in non-military areas to establish a bulwark against the loss of humanity's technological advancement after the Great War destroyed the world. Once close allies of the New California Republic on the West Coast, by the 23rd century, they severed official ties due to disagreements over the republic's increasingly expansionist foreign policy, though still maintain a degree of civility, with both the NCR and Followers understanding the other is needed if they are to rebuild civilization.

raiders.name: GREAT KHANS
raiders.lore: Descended from Vault 15. Produce chems. Bitter rivalry with NCR. Based in Red Rock Canyon.

raiders.name: FIENDS
raiders.lore: Chem-addicted raiders. Extremely violent. Control Vault 3. Supplied by Motor-Runner.

raiders.name: VIPERS
raiders.lore: Cult of snake-worshiping raiders. Nearly exterminated by the Brotherhood in 2155. Surviving Vipers fragmented into small bands, never regaining their former strength.

raiders.name: GUNNERS
raiders.lore: Ruthless mercenary company operating in the Commonwealth. Essentially well-armed raiders-for-hire ‚Äì they take any contract and show no mercy. Better organized and equipped than typical raiders, with strongholds like Gunners Plaza in Boston.

raiders.name: POWDER GANGERS
raiders.lore: Former NCR correctional laborers turned explosive-focused raider gang in the Mojave.

raiders.name: FACTION
raiders.lore: A faction is a grouping of like-minded individuals, united in a common goal or set of common goals. The individuals band together as a way of achieving these goals and advancing their agenda.

mutants.name: DEATHCLAW
mutants.lore: Apex predator. Created from chameleon DNA. Intelligent pack hunters. Horns and claws can pierce armor.

mutants.name: RADSCORPION
mutants.lore: Radscorpions are large, mutated scorpions commonly found in and around abandoned structures and are practically ubiquitous across post-Great War United States.

mutants.name: MIRELURK
mutants.lore: Mutated crabs. Hard shell resists damage. Spit acid. Queens are massive and spawn eggs.

mutants.name: CAZADOR
mutants.lore: Genetically engineered wasp. Created at Big MT. Extremely aggressive. Venom causes paralysis.

mutants.name: BLOATFLY
mutants.lore: A bloatfly is a mutated pest resembling an oversized biting horse or common housefly, often found in Appalachia, the Capital Wasteland, the Commonwealth and the Mojave Wasteland.

mutants.name: CENTAUR
mutants.lore: Failed FEV experiments. Multiple creatures fused together. Loyal to Super Mutants. Spits radioactive sludge.

mutants.name: RADROACH
mutants.lore: Mutated cockroach. Highly resistant to radiation. Found everywhere. Relatively harmless but numerous.

mutants.name: NIGHTKIN
mutants.lore: Nightkin is a name for the elite super mutants of the Unity, created by the Master at Mariposa Military Base. The mutants were the apex of mutant development, corresponding with the Master's vision for the future of humanity.

mutants.name: BEAR (CREATURE)
mutants.lore: Bears are animals from before the Great War. == Background == Several mutated species of bear have come to roam the wastes following the war. Bears typically inhabited forested areas of North America, but occasionally transitioned into grassy plain, alpine and tundra regions.

mutants.name: CREATURE
mutants.lore: Creatures are living beings found throughout the wastelands. They are separate from both humans and plants.

mutants.name: DEATHCLAW
mutants.lore: Deathclaws, colloquially named by most for their signature massive claws, are a species of genetically engineered reptilian creatures originating from secret experiments by the Enclave to create superior battlefield soldiers capable of carrying out high-risk, search-and-destroy missions in place of humans. In the wake of the Great War and their escape into the wild, the deathclaw population exploded and evolved to become an apex predator in the post-nuclear ecosystem of the North American wasteland.

mutants.name: DEATHCLAW GAUNTLET
mutants.lore: The deathclaw gauntlet is a weapon in Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Fallout 4 and Fallout 76.

mutants.name: FISH
mutants.lore: Fish are a group of animals distinguished by being aquatic, having a distinct skull, gills, and no limbs with digits. Due to the horror of the Great War, fish are a rare sight inland and most are horribly mutated.

mutants.name: FLOATER
mutants.lore: Floaters are a unique species of creature, found in New California and Appalachia.

mutants.name: FOG CRAWLER
mutants.lore: Fog crawlers are creatures encountered on Mount Desert Island in the Fallout 4 add-on Far Harbor and in the Mire region of Appalachia in Fallout 76.

mutants.name: GECKO (CREATURE)
mutants.lore: Geckos are mutated lizards prized for their sleek and durable hides. They are known to inhabit the Mojave Wasteland and New California and its surrounding areas.

mutants.name: GULPER
mutants.lore: Gulpers are mutated creatures resembling giant salamanders, encountered in the Fallout 4 add-on Far Harbor, Fallout 76 and the Fallout TV series.

mutants.name: MUTANT HOUND
mutants.lore: Mutant hounds are creatures found across the post-War United States.

mutants.name: SUPER MUTANT
mutants.lore: Super mutant is a general term referring to humanoid mutants created by exposing a regular human to a variety of the Forced Evolutionary Virus (FEV). The resulting hulking mutants typically possess exceptional strength, endurance, resistance or immunity to disease and radiation, as well as modified intelligence.

mutants.name: WANAMINGO
mutants.lore: Wanamingos, also referred to as aliens or alien things, are a variety of mutant creatures.

mutants.name: YAO GUAI
mutants.lore: Yao guai are the mutated descendants of the American black bear. These vicious creatures are found in Appalachia, the Capital Wasteland, the Commonwealth, the Island, Zion Canyon, and rarely, New California.

mutants.name: BROKEN STEEL
mutants.lore: Broken Steel is the third add-on for Fallout 3, developed and published by Bethesda Softworks. == Release == Broken Steel was initially released exclusively as downloadable content on Xbox Live and Games for Windows Live on May 5, 2009. After difficulties with the initial download for PC users, it was re-released for Games for Windows Live on May 7, 2009.

mutants.name: FALLOUT 76
mutants.lore: Fallout 76 is a post-apocalyptic multiplayer online role-playing game developed by Bethesda Game Studios and published by Bethesda Softworks. It is the sixth installment in the Fallout series (ninth overall) and released on Windows, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One on November 14, 2018. Fallout 76 receives free seasonal updates via patches.

robots.name: ASSAULTRON
robots.lore: Military robot. Feminine silhouette for infiltration. Devastating head-mounted laser. Fast melee attacks.

robots.name: SENTRY BOT
robots.lore: Heavy combat robot. Treaded movement. Equipped with gatling guns and missiles. Slow but devastating.

robots.name: PROTECTRON
robots.lore: Common service robot. RobCo design. Police, fire, construction variants. Weak armor but numerous.

humans.name: SUPER MUTANT
humans.lore: Humans dipped in FEV. Incredibly strong and durable. Most are sterile and dim-witted. Masters and Mariposa strains.

humans.name: FERAL GHOULS
humans.lore: Ghouls who lost their mind to radiation. Aggressive and feral. Attack on sight. Healed by radiation.

all.name: OVERVIEW
all.lore: Black Isle's Fallout 3. Set in Arizona, Utah, Colorado. Player starts as a prisoner. Cancelled when Interplay shut down.

all.name: B.O.M.B-001
all.lore: Ballistic Orbital Missile Base. Chinese space station with working nukes. Player could access it.

all.name: PRISONER ORIGIN
all.lore: Player was a prisoner with amnesia. Would discover their past crimes as the story progressed.

all.name: DENVER (DOG CITY)
all.lore: Overrun by packs of wild dogs. Survivors lived in high buildings. Dogs learned to use elevators.

all.name: NEW CANAAN
all.lore: Mormon settlement in Utah. Peaceful community. Later appeared in Honest Hearts DLC for New Vegas.

all.name: HOOVER DAM (ORIGINAL)
all.lore: Central location. NCR vs Caesar's Legion (called Blackfoot Tribe). Similar to New Vegas version.

all.name: VAN BUREN
all.lore: Van Buren is the codename Black Isle Studios assigned to their second iteration of Fallout 3. It saw development by Black Isle Studios until its cancelation in December 8, 2003 and would have been published by Interplay Entertainment. == Development == Black Isle Studios planned to include a dual-combat system in the game that allowed for the player to choose between real-time (Bethesda Softworks' Fallout games and Micro Fort√© and 14¬∞ East's Fallout Tactics) or turn-based combat (Fallout and Fallout 2) but real-time was only included due to Interplay's demands.
